trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls that display their data in list or tabular form.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class is the base class used for ASP.NET controls that retrieve tabular or list-style data from an ASP.NET data source control and bind user-interface (UI) elements of the control to that data for display.

Composite data-bound controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>; list-style data-bound controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList>; and other controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl>.
Page developers do not use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class directly; instead, they use controls that derive from this class.

Control developers extend this class to create data-bound controls that work with classes that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> interface and classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceControl> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> classes.

When deriving a class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class, override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method to bind the UI elements of your control to data retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method.
In most cases, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is the only method you will override in your derived class.
For ASP.NET 2.0 data-bound controls, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method is the equivalent of the `DataBind` method, and is called to bind data at run time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> methods.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl"></xref> class for use by an inherited class instance.
This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.
Occurs when data methods are being called.
The purpose of this event is to give you an opportunity to specify that the data methods to be called are on a different object than the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
Creates a default <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object used by the data-bound control if no arguments are specified.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.CreateDataSourceSelectArguments%2A> method is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.SelectArguments%2A> property to initialize a default arguments object, and by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class's implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> initialized to <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.Empty"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource"></xref> object is being created.

The purpose of this event is to give you an opportunity to change the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSourceView> instance in scenarios where you want to use a custom class that derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSourceView> class.
Gets or sets the name of the list of data that the data-bound control binds to, in cases where the data source contains more than one distinct list of data items.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.DataMember%2A> property is stored in view state.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
The name of the specific list of data that the data-bound control binds to, if more than one list is supplied by a data source control.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the ID of the control from which the data-bound control retrieves its list of data items.
The ID of a control that represents the data source from which the data-bound control retrieves its data.
Gets an object that implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataSource"></xref> interface, which provides access to the object's data content.
An object with access to its data content.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceView"></xref> object that the data-bound control uses to perform data operations.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method retrieves a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> object from the associated data source control by calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetDataSource%2A> method.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property is used to identify a data source, a default <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> object is created.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceView"></xref> that the data-bound control uses to perform data operations.

If the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.DataMember"></xref> property is set, a specific, named <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceView"></xref> is returned; otherwise, the default <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceView"></xref> is returned.
Both the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID"></xref> properties are set.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.DataMember"></xref> property is set but a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceView"></xref> object by that name does not exist.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataSource"></xref> interface that the data-bound control is associated with, if any.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetDataSource%2A> method internally.

A valid <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> instance is retrieved by these two methods and is cached by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> object until the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnDataPropertyChanged%2A> method signals that the data source has changed.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataSource"></xref> that represents the data source identified by <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.DataSourceID"></xref>.
The control identified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.DataSourceID"></xref> property does not exist in the current container.
\- or -
The control identified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.DataSourceID"></xref> property does not implement the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IDataSource"></xref> interface.
Gets a value that indicates whether model binding is in use.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
`true` if model binding is in use; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the name of the data item type for strongly typed data binding.
Setting this property enables the `Item` and `BindItem` data-binding expressions.
Setting this method automatically enables Dynamic Data functionality.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The name of the model type.
Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.SaveViewState"></xref> method.
An object that represents the view state to restore.
Sets the state of the control in view state as successfully bound to data.
The data-bound control maintains a value in view state that indicates whether it is currently bound to data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.MarkAsDataBound%2A> method sets the value to `true`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.CreatingModelDataSource"></xref> event.
An object that provides access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSource"></xref> object that is being created.
Rebinds the data-bound control to its data after one of the base data source identification properties changes.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.DataSourceViewChanged"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnDataSourceViewChanged%2A> method notifies a data-bound control that the underlying data source has changed and that the control should rebind and any necessary work should be performed.
Typically, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnDataSourceViewChanged%2A> method is called when a property of the data source view has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A> property to `true` when it raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.DataSourceViewChanged> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnDataSourceViewChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The source of the event, the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceView"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains event data.
Handles the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Load"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.ConfirmInitState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to set the initialized state of the data-bound control and sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A> property to `true` if the HTTP request is not a postback.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains event data.
Sets the initialized state of the data-bound control before the control is loaded.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnPagePreLoad%2A> method is overridden by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true` in cases where the HTTP request is a postback and view state is enabled but the data-bound control has not yet been bound.
This scenario is common with controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView>, where the visibility of the control is changed at run time.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref> that raised the event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
When overridden in a derived class, binds data from the data source to the control.

Implement this method instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A> method when you derive a data-bound control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class.

Placing your control's data-binding logic in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> enables you to avoid the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBinding> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBound> events being raised in the wrong order.

While the base <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class provides no specific implementation for this method, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method to bind the values of any user interface (UI) controls to the data that is retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> list of data returned from a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect"></xref> method call.
Retrieves data from the associated data source.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is called after data is retrieved to bind data to elements of the data-bound control.
Derived types override this method to retrieve data only if the default implementation is not adequate.

Typically, it is sufficient to provide a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback> delegate that performs any custom data work, rather than implementing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method.
Saves any view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
The control's current view state.
If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns `null`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object that the data-bound control uses when retrieving data from a data source control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.SelectArguments%2A> property calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.CreateDataSourceSelectArguments%2A> method to create a default <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> value used by the data-bound control to retrieve data.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.Empty"></xref>.
The name of the method to call in order to read data.
Setting this property causes model binding to be used as the data-binding method.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The name of the method.
Causes view-state changes to the control to be tracked so they can be stored in the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
Verifies that the object a data-bound control binds to is one it can work with.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.ValidateDataSource%2A> method is only called in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class's mutator (`set` accessor) for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class checks the type of the object that is set for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property to ensure that it is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, or <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An object set to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource"></xref> property.
The object passed by the dataSource parameter is not `null` or a recognized type.
